text:
Hi Blessing. Nice to be introduced to you.

Just a little about me: I work in visualisation for movies/tv. Previsualisation is my forte. (There is also postvis, techvis, pitchvis).

If you don’t know what Previs is (most people haven’t heard of it), then let me explain:

It’s like the next step on from storyboarding. We create a CG animated version of the sequence before they shoot it. So it enables the director to try out different ideas and really hone the sequence before they shoot it. Then the previs is used as a guide on set. The sequences we work on tend to be the big VFX-heavy sequences.

Could you tell me a little about yourself and what ideas you have for your future?

Also, here are some links to some of the major visualisation companies so you can look at their reels and see what they do:

<http://thethirdfloorinc.com>

<https://www.halon.com>

Halon also release a lot of reels generally, so a quick google of “halon previs” will throw up a lot of reel videos to have a look at.

<http://www.nvizage.com>

<https://www.proof-inc.com>

attachments.text: HALON brings together industry leading Directors, Supervisors and Artists who are committed to advancing the art of storytelling through Previs and Postvis.

attachments.title: nvizage
attachments.text: With the use of previs and postvis techniques, producing feature films can be far less complicated. We provide a valuable tool for the director.

attachments.text: Previsulization, Techvisualization, Postvisualization, In-House VFX for Film and Television, Advertising and Immersive entertainment. Seeing in more than Believing. Seeing is Proof.
